examples: He cannot abide criticism.
So it's also important that other people in this globalization construct abide by the rules of globalization.
Ugh, Renoir, whom I cannot abide.
But this same technology can also be used on us law abiding citizens.
And so law abiding, we will disappear into this country's amnesiac fog.
words.defineEn: (always negative) to tolerate someone or something
words.defineVi: (luôn phủ định) chịu đựng ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: She won the admiration of many people in her battle against cancer.
The athlete's record-breaking performance in the championship game knocked his opponents out of the park, securing his place in history and earning him widespread admiration and respect.
After reading her biography, I saw her accomplishments in a different light and gained a deeper admiration for her resilience and determination.
John witnessed how a known scam artist was treated with respect and admiration once he had made a fortune through his shady dealings.
She had always admired the celebrity from afar, but after meeting them in person, she realized that admiration is the daughter of ignorance - she had not known the person behind the public persona.
words.defineEn: a feeling of much respect for and approval of someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất tôn trọng và chấp thuận của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: She adores her little alligator pouch.
I absolutely adore these two bowties!
I adore him.
I just adore to work.
and I just have adored every second of this journey.
words.defineEn: to love and respect someone very much
words.defineVi: yêu và tôn trọng ai đó rất nhiều

examples: - It's an acquired taste.
words.defineEn: something that one dislikes first but starts to like it with the passage of time
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mà người ta không thích đầu tiên nhưng bắt đầu thích nó với thời gian trôi qua

examples: Lots of people are allergic to it.
Most people are just allergic to it.
I'm allergic.
In a clinical trial, one in four patients developed severe allergic reactions to the drug.
I'm allergic to nothing.
words.defineEn: characterized by a strong dislike or hatred toward someone
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi sự không thích hoặc thù hận mạnh mẽ đối với ai đó

examples: Things like immigration reform that are an anathema to most of his colleagues, he has always been a proponent of, and consequently he has been given probably more respect by Democrats across the aisle than an awful lot of Republicans.
Almost everything stylistically, and many things about Trump substantively, were anathema to John McCain.

A Donald Trump presidency is going to be anathema to at least part of the population and greatly welcomed by another part, and those two Americas have been at war with one another and they are likely to continue to be so.

But now, here again, was going to be a conservative taking the place of a liberal, and it was worse yet for many people, because he was an African American, and many people resented or despised the fact that a conservative African American would take positions that were anathema to many people in the more liberal wing of American politics.
words.defineEn: something that is gravely hated and disapproved of
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó bị ghét nghiêm trọng và không được chấp thuận

words.defineEn: having or showing extreme hatred or hostility toward someone
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện sự căm ghét hoặc thù địch cực độ đối với ai đó

examples: From the left come hyper-woke accusations and antipathy towards free enterprise, the very means of our prosperity.
If you take anything from this video, let it be this: empathy in the classroom rather than antipathy can yield incredible results.
words.defineEn: a strong feeling of aversion, opposition, or dislike
words.defineVi: một cảm giác ác cảm, phản đối hoặc không thích mạnh mẽ

examples: U.S. consumers are notoriously averse to friction.
I don’t think he’s totally averse to deals, transactions, maybe not.
And if people are really averse to needles, you could always topically numb someone to help that pain dissipate.

And, of course, the more risk tolerant person will invest more in stocks and reap the benefits, and the more risk averse people will perhaps stay more on the sidelines and potentially miss the game as a result.
Or maybe I'm really risk averse, and I put it in government bonds, and I get 4% a year.
words.defineEn: Being strongly opposed to something or disliking it
words.defineVi: Bị phản đối mạnh mẽ với một cái gì đó hoặc không thích nó

examples: Adriene: Understanding of loss aversion can help businesses and policymakers influence decisions.
This is loss aversion at work.
Loss aversion might influence the endowment effect, and likely affects people’s reasoning in that disease dilemma, too.
But it can also include an aversion to bumps, clusters, blobs and bubbles.
And here's another long-term economic negative, says libertarian economic historian Deirdre McCloskey: the president's aversion to trade.
words.defineEn: a strong feeling of dislike toward someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác không thích mạnh mẽ đối với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to like somebody very much in a romantic way
words.defineVi: thích ai đó rất nhiều trong một cách lãng mạn

examples: Pop is a feast to the ears of many, but I despise it.
James' teacher wanted to impart the wisdom of the ages to his students, so he often said that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Others despise it.
And lastly, I despise cold weather.
He just despises you now, yeah.
words.defineEn: to hate and have no respect for something or someone
words.defineVi: để ghét và không có sự tôn trọng cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: She couldn't hide her grimace of disgust when she tasted the spoiled milk.
The student couldn't hide his disgust and grimaced when he saw the grade on his test.
No, they were disgusted.
Or you might learn disgust from others.
So disgust can help mold individual values and biases.
words.defineEn: a strong feeling of distaste for someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác chán ghét mạnh mẽ cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: I took a dislike to him.
He dislikes the taste of celery and avoids it in his meals.
Dees disliked all editors on principle, but he had to admit that this one at least gave credit where credit was due.
My son dislikes the taste of cayenne pepper as he finds it too spicy.
The person who pursued their passion and found fulfillment in their work was happier than the person who had a high-paying job but disliked what they did.
words.defineEn: to not like a person or thing
words.defineVi: để không thích một người hoặc điều

examples: I took a dislike to him.
He dislikes the taste of celery and avoids it in his meals.
Dees disliked all editors on principle, but he had to admit that this one at least gave credit where credit was due.
My son dislikes the taste of cayenne pepper as he finds it too spicy.
The person who pursued their passion and found fulfillment in their work was happier than the person who had a high-paying job but disliked what they did.
words.defineEn: the feeling of not liking something or someone
words.defineVi: cảm giác không thích một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: In the end, psychologists haven’t pinpointed exactly what causes the IKEA effect, and it may be that some combination of these ideas is what makes you so enamored with that table, no matter how crooked it is.
words.defineEn: having a strong liking or admiration for something
words.defineVi: có một ý thích mạnh mẽ hoặc ngưỡng mộ cho một cái gì đó

examples: The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
A fire attack shall chill the enemy to the bone.
The enemy was driven back.
The weakness of the enemy makes our strength.
They were working hand in glove with our enemies.
words.defineEn: someone who is against a person, or hates them
words.defineVi: một người chống lại một người, hoặc ghét họ

words.defineEn: the fact of having or showing unreasonable tendency or preference toward some things and not others, particularly food
words.defineVi: thực tế là có hoặc thể hiện xu hướng hoặc sở thích vô lý đối với một số thứ chứ không phải những thứ khác, đặc biệt là thực phẩm

words.defineEn: having or showing an unreasonable tendency to like some things and not others, particularly food
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện một xu hướng vô lý để thích một số thứ và không thích những thứ khác, đặc biệt là thức ăn

examples: The court found in her favor.

I favor anything that tilts the scales in my direction.

do me a favor and stick a sock in it.
words.defineEn: to prefer someone or something to an alternative
words.defineVi: để thích một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó để thay thế

examples: This sort of counterintuitive result is why misleading statistics are a favored tool of unscrupulous politicians and nefarious Diskymon trainers alike.
In the U.S., a more favored approach is deterrence, which tries to reduce crime by making the prospect of getting caught sufficiently awful.
words.defineEn: having characteristics or features that makes something or someone preferable
words.defineVi: có đặc điểm hoặc tính năng mà làm cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó thích hợp hơn

examples: Crystallography is an incredibly finicky technique.
Telescopes are finicky, but if you put them in the right spot, you can learn amazing things about the universe.
It’s incredibly finicky and requires a ton of coordinated hand-eye feedback to maintain.
In another case, some blackbirds and song thrushes kept their eggs neatly arranged in the nest, while others were less finicky.
If you go the all-natural route, expect to pay big bucks, though, because vanilla beans are the fruits of finicky tropical orchids.
words.defineEn: demanding or showing an excessive care and attention to small details
words.defineVi: đòi hỏi hoặc thể hiện sự quan tâm và chú ý quá mức đến những chi tiết nhỏ

words.defineEn: in a way that is based on one's tastes or wishes
words.defineVi: theo cách dựa trên thị hiếu hoặc mong muốn của một người

examples: Talk about a frenemy.
And then I have my nemesis, my enemy, my frenemy.
Up next we got Frenemy.
But the contributions of Darwin’s lesser-known frenemy Wallace still deserve to be remembered.
When we look for habitable worlds orbiting other stars, it might be useful not just to look for Earth-like planets, but also to see what a Jupiter-like frenemy might be up to nearby.
words.defineEn: a person who pretends to be a friend when in reality is one's rival or enemy
words.defineVi: một người giả vờ là bạn trong khi thực tế là đối thủ hoặc kẻ thù của một người

words.defineEn: to choose something among other things

words.defineVi: để ngừng thích một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó hoặc mất hứng thú với họ hoặc nó

Trees and plants even grow on them!

words.defineEn: to gradually like something more and more
words.defineVi: để dần dần thích một cái gì đó ngày càng nhiều

words.defineEn: a deep feeling of anger and dislike toward someone because of what they did in the past
words.defineVi: một cảm giác tức giận sâu sắc và không thích ai đó vì những gì họ đã làm trong quá khứ
